intro: Oxytropis vassilczenkoi, commonly known as the Vassil'evsky oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant features a slender, upright stem with small, palmately compound leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue to purple, arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, and bloom in late summer. Oxytropis vassilczenkoi is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
